headline.print_headline: Courts Rebuke Iran’s President With Sentences and Ally’s Firing
headline.seo: Two Cases in Iran Tarnish President Ahmadinejad
headline.main: Courts Rebuke Iran’s President With Sentences and Ally’s Firing

docs.snippet: An embezzlement case’s result and a confidant’s dismissal are seen as a rebuke to President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad in his final year in office....
docs.abstract: Iran's Pres Mahmoud Ahmadinejad suffers embarrassments in two politically delicate judicial cases; four people are sentenced to death in a $2.6 billion embezzlement scandal indirectly linked to top aide of Ahmadinejad’s; Supreme Court also orders the dismissal of Saeed Mortazavi, enforcer who helped crush protests that erupted after Ahmadinejad's lopsided 2009 re-election, from his post administering welfare aid in Iran.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and CHRISTINE HAUSER

docs.lead_paragraph: An embezzlement case’s result and a confidant’s dismissal are seen as a rebuke to President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad in his final year in office.

headline.print_headline: Colorado Suspect Is Told He Faces 142 Counts as Case Inches Forward
headline.seo: Colorado Suspect Faces 142 Counts in Shootings
headline.main: Colorado Suspect Is Told He Faces 142 Counts as Case Inches Forward

docs.snippet: Prosecutors formally charged James E. Holmes with 142 criminal counts, including first degree murder and attempted murder, in the attack at a movie theater....
docs.abstract: James E Holmes shows no visible reaction as prosecutors inform him that he is formally charged with 142 criminal counts, including first degree murder and attempted murder, and faces the possibility of the death penalty.

byline.original: By JACK HEALY and DAN FROSCH

docs.lead_paragraph: Prosecutors formally charged James E. Holmes with 142 criminal counts, including first degree murder and attempted murder, in the attack at a movie theater.

headline.seo: Markets Stall as Investors Wait for Action in Europe

docs.snippet: Hopes are high that the European Central Bank will announce plans to support the euro when its members meet on Thursday....
docs.abstract: Two-day stock rally stalls as investors wait to see if European leaders will act on their promise to keep the continent's monetary union intact.
docs.lead_paragraph: Hopes are high that the European Central Bank will announce plans to support the euro when its members meet on Thursday.

headline.print_headline: Syrian and Rebel Forces Claim Gains in Nation’s Largest City
headline.seo: Syrian Forces and Rebels Claim Gains in Aleppo Fight
headline.main: Syrian and Rebel Forces Claim Gains in Nation’s Largest City

docs.snippet: The battle in Syria’s largest city could signify a decisive moment in the 17-month-old conflict, proving the government’s resilience or exposing its fragility....

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Syrian Army has descended on Aleppo, hoping to rout hundreds and perhaps thousands of armed opposition fighters who have grabbed a tenuous foothold here; battle in Aleppo, Syria’s largest city, could signify a decisive moment in the 17-month-old conflict, proving the government’s resilience or exposing its fragility.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Kareem Fahim, Dalal Mawad and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

docs.lead_paragraph: The battle in Syria’s largest city could signify a decisive moment in the 17-month-old conflict, proving the government’s resilience or exposing its fragility.

docs.snippet: Bloodshed comes to rural France, and certainties collapse....
docs.lead_paragraph: Bloodshed comes to rural France, and certainties collapse.

headline.print_headline: Japan’s Economic Plan Has Blanks to Fill
headline.main: Japan’s Economic Plan Has Blanks to Fill

docs.snippet: Billed as a fundamental rethinking of the world's third-largest economy, it tackles deflation and renewing energy policy after the natural and nuclear disasters last year....
docs.abstract: Japan is set to approve a new growth strategy billed as a fundamental rethinking of the economy, tackling deflation and renewing its energy policy after the natural and nuclear disasters of 2011.
docs.lead_paragraph: Billed as a fundamental rethinking of the world's third-largest economy, it tackles deflation and renewing energy policy after the natural and nuclear disasters last year.

headline.print_headline: With Corn Prices Rising, Meat Prices Are Likely to Follow
headline.main: With Corn Prices Rising, Meat Prices Are Likely to Follow

docs.snippet: Makers of livestock feed are being hurt by corn prices. But more worrying for Asia’s livestock industry is the lack of alternatives, as wheat feed stockpiles are running low this year....
docs.lead_paragraph: Makers of livestock feed are being hurt by corn prices. But more worrying for Asia’s livestock industry is the lack of alternatives, as wheat feed stockpiles are running low this year.

headline.print_headline: The Life Aquatic Catches the Olympian Mood
headline.main: The Life Aquatic Catches the Olympian Mood

docs.snippet: While streamlined swimsuits and sturdy two-pieces are designed for athletes competing in rarefied Olympic sports like beach volleyball, fashion plays on the more romantic notes of ocean and shoreline....
docs.lead_paragraph: While streamlined swimsuits and sturdy two-pieces are designed for athletes competing in rarefied Olympic sports like beach volleyball, fashion plays on the more romantic notes of ocean and shoreline.

docs.snippet: It is hard, as an outsider, to avoid the impression that Germany's success has bred a stubborn reluctance to jeopardize jealously guarded gains as Europe looks to it for billions to solve the euro crisis....
docs.lead_paragraph: It is hard, as an outsider, to avoid the impression that Germany's success has bred a stubborn reluctance to jeopardize jealously guarded gains as Europe looks to it for billions to solve the euro crisis.
